body:
<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/
-->


**What happened**:
Setup a kubernetes cluster with dual stack enabled, set kube-proxy to "ipvs" proxy mode, many warnings are flooding in kube-proxy pod log,
W0303 22:11:22.027597       1 meta_proxier.go:121] failed to update endpoints kube-system/kube-scheduler with error failed to identify ipfamily for endpoints (no subsets)
W0303 22:11:22.697358       1 meta_proxier.go:121] failed to update endpoints kube-system/kube-controller-manager with error failed to identify ipfamily for endpoints (no subsets)
W0303 22:11:24.035937       1 meta_proxier.go:121] failed to update endpoints kube-system/kube-scheduler with error failed to identify ipfamily for endpoints (no subsets)
W0303 22:11:24.704413       1 meta_proxier.go:121] failed to update endpoints kube-system/kube-controller-manager with error failed to identify ipfamily for endpoints (no subsets)
W0303 22:11:26.049657       1 meta_proxier.go:121] failed to update endpoints kube-system/kube-scheduler with error failed to identify ipfamily for endpoints (no subsets)

**What you expected to happen**:
No such error logs
**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Here is my setup step, I'm using a single master node setup,

kubeadm init --pod-network-cidr=192.168.0.0/16,fc00::/112 --service-cidr=10.96.0.0/16,fd00::/112 --feature-gates=IPv6DualStack=true
Change controller-manager cidr configuration
--node-cidr-mask-size-ipv6=120
install calico 3.6.4 with dual stack enabled
kube-proxy proxy mode set to "ipvs"
featureGates:
      IPv6DualStack: true
    healthzBindAddress: ""
    hostnameOverride: ""
    iptables:
      masqueradeAll: false
      masqueradeBit: null
      minSyncPeriod: 0s
      syncPeriod: 0s
    ipvs:
      excludeCIDRs: null
      minSyncPeriod: 0s
      scheduler: ""
      strictARP: false
      syncPeriod: 0s
    kind: KubeProxyConfiguration
    metricsBindAddress: ""
    **mode: "ipvs"**
**Anything else we need to know?**:
Linux Redhat 7.7
**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):v1.17.3
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
- OS (e.g: `cat /etc/os-release`): Redhat 7.7
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 3.10.0-1062.4.1.el7.x86_64
- Install tools: kubeadm
- Network plugin and version (if this is a network-related bug): calico 3.6.4
- Others:

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Network.
labels.name: sig/network

title: IPv6 dual stack: error log flooding when using "ipvs" mode in kube-proxy
